result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Br. 7

Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Defendant Michael A Scott. Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael A Scott in court in custody. State calls witness, Detective C. S. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Lennon with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Fredrickson with cross. Atty. Lennon with redirect. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. Atty. Fredrickson objects, gives argument. Court finds PC for Bindover to branch.
